alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 5:49PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...An intense snow shower will impact portions of northwestern Mineral and west central Sanders Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 549 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an intense snow shower over Lookout Pass, or 11 miles east of Wallace. This shower was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Lookout Pass, Saltese, East Portal and Taft. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 0 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
